image.altText: A woman with glasses smiling at the camera

props.synopsis: An Adelaide family is calling for better communication on ambulance response times after a grandmother with cancer was left waiting for an ambulance in "extreme agony" last year.

title.children: Adelaide woman spent her final day 'in absolute pain' waiting for an ambulance

image.altText: Four male cyclists spraying champagne on stage

props.synopsis: Welshman Stephen Williams has won this year's Tour Down Under in South Australia after a thrilling final stage in the Adelaide Hills.

title.children: Stephen Williams crowned winner of Tour Down Under 2024

image.altText: A woman with strawberry blonde hair smiles in a field of flowers.

props.synopsis: Determined for a better life for her children, a regional South Australian woman has gone from bankrupt to home owner. Kirsty experienced financial abuse, and wants others to know it is possible to rebuild their lives.

title.children: When Kirsty left a DV relationship, her former partner's bankruptcy was transferred to her

image.altText: A man with dark hair and sunglasses.

props.synopsis: The search resumes for missing man Dan Cojocea, who was caught in a rip near Sleaford, south-west of Port Lincoln, on Friday afternoon.

title.children: Search resumes for missing man caught in a rip at SA beach

image.altText: A woman pulls a 3M Aura respirator and an Aranet CO2 monitor out of her black handbag

props.synopsis: Three of Australia's leading COVID-19 experts share their personal safety strategies and reflect on what must happen if we're to blunt the growing health crisis the pandemic is causing — and prepare for the next one.

title.children: Scientist Brendan Crabb broke his own rule and caught COVID. But this is how he had avoided it

image.altText: A man wearing a bright orange shirt pumps his fist in celebration.

props.synopsis: Australia's Alex de Minaur is set to face Andrey Rublev for a place in the Australian Open quarterfinals after 11-time champion Novak Djokovic wins in straight sets. Follow live.

title.children: De Minaur to battle to keep Australian Open dream alive, daytime match doesn't phase Djokovic

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Fritz takes third set off Tsitsipas
Live score: Jannik Sinner vs Karen Khachanov
A set each for Taylor Fritz and Stefanos Tsitsipas

image.altText: Cruz Hewitt plays a forehand at the 2024 Australian Open.

props.synopsis: With his legendary father watching on from the stands, 15-year-old Cruz Hewitt competes in the boys' singles tournament at the Australian Open for the first time.

title.children: Tennis great Lleyton Hewitt's son Cruz makes Australian Open debut

image.altText: White and pearl covered opals.

props.synopsis: The main street of Andamooka often floods after heavy rain. And when it all dries, locals hit the road with buckets in hand, searching for newly uncovered opals.

title.children: Rain is unveiling rare opals in this outback town — and a chance to 'noodle' for riches

image.altText: A composite image of Peter Malinauskas and Basil Zempilas.

props.synopsis: Earlier this week, SA's premier Peter Malinauskas compared Perth's Test match to "flogging a dead horse". But in a tongue-in-cheek spat, the city's lord mayor has since fired back — by threatening to poach the AFL's Gather Round from Adelaide.

title.children: 'We'll come after Gather Round': Test cricket crowds trigger cross-border slanging match

image.altText: large yellow bags laid out on the tarmac in front of a light plane

props.synopsis: The arrest of company director Mei Lin in Brisbane last week has raised concerns in PNG government circles due to her links to business interests associated with political figures, including former deputy prime minister Moses Maladina.

title.children: Australian refugee funds reportedly linked to companies associated with woman arrested over alleged PNG drug flight

image.altText: A man using a blowtorch to heat a pipe near a stairway

props.synopsis: Russia's dilapidated infrastructure is struggling to keep up with plummeting temperatures. Heating is a major concern and freezing residents are taking to social media to vent about their "fight for survival".

title.children: Russia's central heating system is failing, and experts warn an 'avalanche of disasters' is coming

image.altText: A waterfall runs to a river with a bridge and wall on the opposite side covered in icicles

props.synopsis: Two weeks of winter storms in the United States have turned roads into icy death traps, frozen people to death and caused power outages that could take weeks to fix.

title.children: Ice, snow and freezing temperatures kill dozens across US

image.altText: Paraburdoo Photo

props.synopsis: Temperatures in the small Pilbara town of Paraburdoo reached their highest recorded level of 47.9 degrees Celsius on Saturday, as an extreme heatwave continues to bake the region.

title.children: WA town breaks 26-year temperature record as BOM forecasts near-50C heat

image.altText: A little girl walks past rubble

props.synopsis: Hiba used to live in a modern apartment building in southern Gaza, spending her days at school or playing with friends. Now, every day is a fight to survive to the next.

title.children: How the daily struggle for this Palestinian family to stay alive falls on 12-year-old Hiba

image.altText: Still from the new government sexual consent campaign where a women is smearing milkshake cream on mans face

props.synopsis: Consent educators should use plain, relatable language and start teaching children "well before" they have their first sexual encounter, according to new federal government guidelines.

title.children: Start early and skip the milkshakes: The government's tips for teaching consent to kids

image.altText: A black dog sitting on a rug

props.synopsis: A spaniel born with six legs that was found abandoned in a supermarket parking lot has her extra limbs surgically removed.

title.children: Six-legged spaniel undergoes surgery to remove extra limbs, now adjusting to life on four paws

image.altText: A man on a stretcher being airflited to an ambulance helicopter.

props.synopsis: Emergency workers have airlifted a man in his 80s to safety after he fell down a cliff in Marysville, sustaining head and pelvis injuries.

title.children: Man in his 80s rescued after falling down cliff face in Victoria's Yarra Ranges

image.altText: Sunbakers lie on a rock near the water with Sydney Harbour Bridge in the background

props.synopsis: Swimming in the harbour can make you sick and risk your life. Here's how to avoid it, and what experts say to do if you accidentally fall in.

title.children: For many, it's an unspoken rule to not swim in the middle of Sydney Harbour. But why is this the case?

image.altText: a cyclone track map showing a weather system headed towards townsville

props.synopsis: The developing weather system is now considered likely to cross the coast between Cairns and Mackay, bringing heavy rainfall with it.

title.children: Tropical low forecast to approach Queensland coast, intensify into a cyclone tomorrow

image.altText: police car parked in front of flood waters in Brisbane 1974

props.synopsis: As a cyclone hovers menacingly off the Queensland Coast, the lessons learned five decades ago, again in 2011 and more recently in 2022 may be put to the test.

title.children: The $980 million flood catastrophe that changed Brisbane forever

image.altText: A goalkeeper, wearing an orange jersey, applauding his fans after a match.

props.synopsis: AC Milan goalkeeper Mike Maignan calls for strong sanctions to combat racism after hearing crowd members making monkey noises at him during a Serie A match at Udinese.

title.children: Goalkeeper leaves Serie A match over racist chants

image.altText: Police stand outside a townhouse which is behind police tape.

props.synopsis: Police are investigating the circumstances surrounding the death of a baby in Ballarat overnight as a neighbour who tried to resuscitate the boy says she ran to help after hearing screams.

title.children: Police investigating death of two-month-old 'beautiful little boy' in regional Victoria

image.altText: With their back to the camera, a person in a grey hooded jumper with denim jacket over it, looks towards vast expanse of ocean.

props.synopsis: There's a strong connection between living with an eating disorder and having the perfectionism trait. As the negative impacts of that link rise, these experts are calling for better understanding.

title.children: There's a common trait among people with eating disorders, but many don't know about it

image.altText: A map shows Newcastle on the Australian coast, with wind turbines in the sea

props.synopsis: Offshore wind offers great promise for Australia, but the industry will have to win an information war to convince some towns to take it up.

title.children: In the Hunter, offshore wind offers a new life after coal — but some locals see it as a threat

image.altText: Pat Tiernan smiles as he crosses the finish line of a marathon

props.synopsis: Pat Tiernan hung up his track running spikes after the Tokyo Olympics, but now has his eyes firmly on Paris after running Australia's second-fastest marathon of all time.

title.children: Australian marathon runners 'taking it to the rest of the world' ahead of Olympics

image.altText: An Indigenous man with white hair, standing on a river bank.

props.synopsis: Yorta Yorta leaders want people to "read the language of the land" after January flooding along the Goulburn River.

title.children: Indigenous leaders concerned country is being mismanaged, leading to severe flooding

image.altText: Taylor Swift smiles as she performs on stage.

props.synopsis: CPR is all about staying alive, but your love of the Barbie soundtrack or Taylor Swift's many eras could potentially help you keep someone's heart pumping.

title.children: Could knowing the beat to your favourite song save a life?

image.altText: A huge crowd of people in a very narrow alleyway at night

props.synopsis: Kim Kwang-ho, head of the Seoul Metropolitan Police Agency, has been charged with professional negligence over the deadly 2022 Halloween crush that killed nearly 160 people, prosecutors said.

title.children: Seoul police chief charged over deadly Halloween crush

image.altText: Mac Horton holds a gold medal

props.synopsis: Olympic and World Champion Mack Horton, who made headlines for his stance against controversial Chinese swimmer Sun Yang at the 2019 World Championships, has retired from swimming.

title.children: Swimming champion and 'quality person' Horton calls time on career ahead of Paris Games

image.altText: James Cromitie center led police officers Terror Sting

props.synopsis: A man convicted in 2010 of plotting to blow up New York City synagogues, a Jewish community centre and shoot down military planes, has been ordered to be released from prison by a judge who said the defendant was part of a group manipulated by the FBI.

title.children: US judge orders early release of 'hapless' petty criminal caught up in post-9/11 terror sting

image.altText: A woman sitting on the floor in her child's bedroom.

props.synopsis: Zane Mellor was one of six children who died at Tasmania's Hillcrest Primary School in December 2021 after a jumping castle became airborne. His mother is questioning why it's taking the Tasmanian government so long to act on industrial manslaughter laws.

title.children: A Tasmanian mother whose son died in the Hillcrest tragedy is pushing for industrial manslaughter laws
